alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central West Baton Rouge and southwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 1100 PM CDT... At 1017 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brownfields, or near Baker, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Port Allen, Westminster, Merrydale, Brownfields, Inniswold and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 151 and 161. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
